sources.content: CDN (Content Delivery Network) is a distributed network of servers that delivers content to users based on their geographic location. CDNs improve website performance by caching content closer to end users.
HTTP caching strategies include browser caching, proxy caching, and CDN caching. Each layer helps reduce latency and server load.
DNS resolution can be optimized by using CDN providers who have distributed DNS servers across multiple regions.
Project requirements include setting up a CDN for static assets to improve load times globally.
Load balancing distributes traffic across multiple servers. This is different from CDN which focuses on content delivery.
Networking basics include understanding protocols, routing, and data transmission.

follow_up_questions: What are the benefits of using a CDN?
